elements.text: PART ONE
SCENE 1. INT. SHIPYARD (BREAK ROOM)
F/X A SIDE ROOM IN A SHIPYARD ON MERSEYSIDE, AUTUMN 1991.
IT CONTAINS AN ARCADE MACHINE, A STREET FIGHTER II
GAME. DRAMATIC 16-BIT MUSIC AND SOUND EFFECTS. VINNY'’S ABOUT TO BEAT JOEL.
Yes — come on son, come on —
No no no — you won’t get me like —
Yes yes —
F/X VINNY BASHES SOME BUTTONS — AND IN THE GAME, WE HEAR
JOEL'S CHARACTER FALL BACK, SCREAMING.
No!
F/X THE GAME ANNOUNCES: “YOU WIN!”
You massacred me! What was that move?
Spinning Spider Strike. You roll the stick down-back-up and hit the kick button.
That’s brutal, Vinny.
Another game?
Should really get back to work.
Nah, we’ve still got ten minutes of lunch. Don’t give the company your time for free, Joel.
Some of us are grateful to have a job at all, y’know. Me dad’s been out of work ten years —
F/X VINNY PUTS A COIN IN THE SLOT.
#228: THE BLOOD FURNACE by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 3
I put the coin in now, can’t waste it.
OK, OK — just a quick one.
F/X THEY’RE PLAYING AGAIN.
So they got you working on the bridge now?
Yeah, fiddly work. The instrument panels arrived this morning and the connections — well it’s weird, instead of wires, it’s like pipes, like you’d have for —
F/X RAPID SEQUENCE ON PUNCHES IN THE GAME.
How did you do that move?
OK, watch my hands, yeah?
I’m watching.
Down, back, up and then any —
F/X A FLICKERING NOISE — VINNY’S DISGUISE IS GLITCHING — THEN
A SLIMY SOUND AS VINNY MOVES HIS HANDS.
Vinny? What — what’s happening to —
Oh.
Your hands. That’s not —
It’s fine.
Fine? They’ve gone black and they look like they’re melting! I knew something like this would happen, handling all that stuff, we’ve got to [tell —]
No.
#228: THE BLOOD FURNACE by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 4
But it could happen to someone else!
We’re not telling anyone.
How can you be so calm about this? We have to — (MUFFLED)
F/X JOEL’S MOUTH IS COVERED BY VINNY’S SLIMY ALIEN HAND. HE
WHILE THE ARCADE GAME MUSIC CONTINUES IN THE BACKGROUND.
Sorry mate.
MUFFLED, STARTS TO CHOKE — HIS MOUTH FILLING UP WITH LIQUID
#228: THE BLOOD FURNACE by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 5
SCENE 2. EXT. DECK
F/X ON THE DECK OF THE SHIP THAT’S UNDER CONSTRUCTION IN THE
SHIPYARD. TARDIS LANDS; DOOR OPENS; ACE EMERGES.
We’re on a ship.
(FOLLOWING) A space ship?
No, just a ship ship.
Oh yes! But we’re not at sea...
F/X DOCTOR EMERGES.
No, Mel. This ship is still under construction. We’re on Merseyside and the year is 1991.
Great. (BEAT) Let’s go somewhere else.
No, Ace.
There’s not going to be anything worth doing here, unless Everton happen to be playing Charlton today.
They won’t be, you’re in Division Two at the moment.
Dark times.
F/X DOCTOR STARTS WALKING OFF.
Let’s just take a quick look below deck. These old hulks are beautiful pieces of engineering, you know...
#228: THE BLOOD FURNACE by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 6
SCENE 3. INT. SHIP (STAIRWELL/PASSAGE)
F/X DOCTOR DESCENDS SOME STEPS, FOLLOWED BY ACE AND MEL:.
Unusual design...
What sort of ship is it?
I thought it was a cargo ship at first, but there are some very odd touches — I wonder if perhaps it’s military...
Military?
Oh now you’re interested.
F/X OFF THE STAIRWELL; WALKING ALONG A PASSAGEWAY.
Worried, actually. What do we say if they find us poking around?
It’s Sunday. The yard is closed, we have the complete run of the [place —]
F/X LEE CALLS TO THEM FROM FURTHER ALONG.
(OFF) Oi! Who are you?
Or.. maybe it’s Tuesday.
(MARCHING OVER TO THEM) You can’t just wander in here — where’d
[you —]
I’m the Doctor — thank heavens you’re here.
Me?
Yes! Who are you?
Lee Clayton, shop floor manager. Wait, if you’ve [been —]
#228: THE BLOOD FURNACE by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 7
Oh, good! We’re an inspection team from, er...
The Foreign Office. Exports like this are just what Britain needs right now.
Did you clear this with the boss?
Of course! Go and check with him.
I will. You [wait —]
F/X ANOTHER WORKER COMES HURTLING ALONG THE PASSAGE.
(OFF) Lee! Lee! I just found Joel in the break room, lying on
his back [and he —]
There’s a shock — tell the idle sod to get back to work.
(OFF) He’s dead!
Y’what? (TO DOCTOR) You lot, stay here!
No, we’re coming too.
F/X DOCTOR MARCHES ON BEFORE LEE CAN STOP HIM.
#228: THE BLOOD FURNACE by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 8
SCENE 4. INT. SHIPYARD (STUART: ’S OFFICE)
F/X STUART IS ON THE PHONE TO ORLA.
(D) They’re in a green folder marked ‘payroll’.
Who put them in a green folder marked ‘payroll’?
(D) You did, before you signed them off last time.
F/X FLURRY OF SHUFFLING FILES.
Yes I can see it now. Thank you, Orla.
(D) I’m not your secretary, Stuart.
I’m going to get one, I promise — and we’re going to set up database, and —
(D) Yes, I know. I’m sorry to leave you in the lurch —
No no, I’m sorry to call you at home. How are you?
(D) They say the morning sickness should go away about now.
Rest up. I think we’ve got all we need to [complete —]
F/X STUART'S PHONE BUZZES.
Sorry, Orla, I’ve got a call on the other line. I’1l let you get back to Neighbours.
(D) I’m not watching Neighbours, I'm —
F/X STUART SWITCHES TO THE OTHER LINE.
Hello?
#228: THE BLOOD FURNACE by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 9
SCENE 5. INT. SHIPYARD (CORRIDOR)
F/X OUTSIDE THE BREAK ROOM. LEE EMERGES, CLOSING DOOR BEHIND.
HE’S QUITE SHAKEN.
(TO SELF) Oh, man. That’s just —
Well?
Do you know anything about this?
& ACE: No.
But we’d like to. What happened to the man in there?
Well he’s dead!
I’m very sorry. Could I see the body?
Doctor —
Nobody’s going in there until the police arrive.
We want to help.
Listen, I don’t like you. I don’t think you’re from the Foreign Office and even if you were I wouldn’t like that either.
Look — we didn’t kill him.
He never said we did.
But he thought it. Look, Lee: we’re not from the Foreign Office, we just came to have a look around, we didn’t realise it was off-limits —
There’s a massive sign on every gate.
#228: THE BLOOD FURNACE by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 10
Afraid of what we might see?
(BEAT) No. Safety reasons.
We're sorry for trespassing —
F/X STUART IS WALKING OVER.
(GOBSMACKED) It can’t be...
(NOT NOTICING HIM) But we had nothing to do with the death [of that —]
Melanie?
How do you know my — (ASTONISHED) Stuart?
What... what on Earth are you doing here?
Friend of yours, Doughnut?
Boss — do you want to see —
What is it, Lee?
Joel!
Of course, sorry. Have you called the police?
Yeah. And I found this lot wandering [about —]
On the ship you’re building. Nowhere near the body.
Melanie, are these friends of yours?
Yes, and they’re not murderers, I promise.
#228: THE BLOOD FURNACE by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 11
Did you come to see me?
No.
(DISAPPOINTED) Oh.
So you didn’t know they were coming?
We already admitted that.
Lee, it’s fine. I’ve known Melanie since college. We were, uh —
(TO MEL) Was he?
Yes.
Right.
And what about these two?
(SIGHS) This is my friend Ace and... her... uncle.
Hello. I’m the Doctor.
He’s a bit of a.. shipping enthusiast — he’s harmless.
Completely harmless.
Lee, we need to look at our security.
We’ve locked the whole yard down, boss — nobody’s to leave until the police get here.
Good, good. This is terrible, with Joel — keep me posted, I’d like to have a chat with Melanie.
#228: THE BLOOD FURNACE by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 12
All right.
(TO STUART) Do you have any tea, or [maybe —]
I think he means just her.
Oh.
F/X MEL AND STUART WALK AWAY.
(TO TONY) Tony — keep an eye on them. I’ve got to make sure everyone knows about — this.
Right.
F/X LEE WALKS AWAY.
(LOW) Ace, I need to see that body.
(LOW) You realise it might just a normal death the police could solve themselves?
(LOW) We should establish that before they get here.
(SIGHS; LOW) Alright, I’ve got an idea. (CALLS) Tony — mate — is there a ladies’ loo around here, or do you not have much call for one?
#228: THE BLOOD FURNACE by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 13
SCENE 6. INT. SHIPYARD (MEETING ROOM)
F/X STUART ENTERS, FOLLOWED BY MEL.
Sorry about the mess — this is technically our meeting room, but we tend to use it as a general overflow workspace...
But it does have a drinks machine.
Yes, it does coffee-flavoured drinks, tea-flavoured drinks, chocolate-flavoured drinks, soup-flavoured drinks —
Coffee.
Coffee-flavoured drink it is.
F/X STUART OPERATES THE MACHINE.
It’s very good to see you. You kept in touch for the first few years after college, but —
Sorry, it wasn’t anything personal — I was travelling.
Travelling?
Why do you say it like that?
You were always so career-focused — never figured you for the type who’d go off and live in a commune in Bali.
It was very much nothing like that.
I’d love to hear more about it.
(CHANGING SUBJECT) You seem to be doing very well. He called you ‘boss’ back there.
Yeah. I mean, I picked up the yard for absolute peanuts —
#228: THE BLOOD FURNACE by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 14
Last time I saw you, you didn’t have enough peanuts to buy a shipyard.
I made a bit of money off this steel process I patented — look, we keep a piece of it mounted on the wall, there.
That’s steel?
Yeah, the process gives it that almost blueish dark gunmetal colour — we call it Dark Alloy.
What else is good about it?
Strength, durability in extreme heat — it’s thinner and lighter without compromising those things.
Did you come up with that all on your own?
Er, yes. Just tinkering around. That’s why my company’s called the Dark Alloy Corporation. Thought it had a nice sort of late Victorian feel.
Very impressive.
(BEAT) You know, your timing couldn’t be better.
Oh?
Follow me.
#228: THE BLOOD FURNACE by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 15
SCENE 7. INT. SHIPYARD
F/X DOCTOR IS STILL STANDING AROUND WHEN LEE RETURNS.
Where’s your niece gone?
Just to the toilets.
Right.
She’s been gone a little while — I hope she’s all right.
F/X SUDDENLY ACE’S VOICE COMES FROM SOME DISTANCE AWAY.
(OFF) Help! Help — he tried to kill me!
Oh my goodness!
Who?
(OFF) Tall bloke, dark hair — he had a flick knife, he went up the stairs!
Right — you guys, come on!
F/X LEE AND SOME OTHER WORKERS PELT IN ACE’S DIRECTION. WHEN
THEY’VE GONE:
(TO HIMSELF) Very effective, Ace.
F/X DOCTOR GOES INTO THE BREAK ROOM.
#228: THE BLOOD FURNACE by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 16
SCENE 8. INT. SHIPYARD (CORRIDOR)
F/X ACE RUNS UP SOME STAIRS. LEE AND SOME OTHER WORKERS ARE
HER.
Up here! This way!
Hoi! Hang back, love, let us deal with this. Did you see where he went?
Through that door.
(SCEPTICAL SUDDENLY) You’re sure?
I heard it bang just before I got here.
F/X LEE RATTLES THE DOOR HANDLE.
It’s locked.
He must’ve locked it from the inside.
F/X LEE’S UNLOCKING THE DOOR.
It doesn’t lock from the inside, because —
F/X LEE OPENS THE DOOR.
It’s a cupboard.
Oh. Maybe he went another way.
Or maybe there was no bloke and you think we’re a bunch of divs.
The thought never crossed my mind.
(TO OTHERS) One of you lot take her to my office.
#228: THE BLOOD FURNACE by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 17
(PUSHING FORWARD) I’11 do it.
Cheers, Vinny. Watch her until I get there.
Come on, love.
F/X VINNY LEADS ACE AWAY.
You're letting him get away!
#228: THE BLOOD FURNACE by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 18
SCENE 9. INT. SHIPYARD (IT CENTRE)
F/X MEL AND STUART WALK IN.
They’re in here...
Ooh. These look fresh out of the box.
F/X STUART TURNS ON A BANK OF COMPUTERS.
This is why we’ve been working in the meeting room a lot — this is going to be the new design and testing centre.
(INHALES) I love that new computer smell.
They’re the first systems we’ve had.
Really? You need to get with the program! (LAUGHS AT OWN JOKE)
Yes, I know — I meant to, but we were stretched for money and time. But I’m dragging us into the Nineties. 3D modelling has improved so much —
Not just your design work — you should be doing your stock- keeping, book-keeping, payroll, client [records —]
Absolutely — and I need someone to manage those systems for me. And it seems like you don’t have a job, so...
(TAKEN ABACK) Oh.
Is that a good ‘oh’?
It’s a surprised ‘oh’.
F/X KNOCK AT DOOR. STUART GOES TO OPEN IT.
You don’t have to say ‘yes’ now. But it’d be great to work with you, so if you could think about it?
#228: THE BLOOD FURNACE by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 19
F/X STUART OPENS THE DOOR TO LEE.
Sorry for interrupting, boss. We’ve got a situation downstairs.
#228: THE BLOOD FURNACE by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 20
SCENE 10. INT. SHIPYARD (BREAK ROOM)
F/X DOCTOR IS ARGUING HIS POSITION.
I did not lay a finger on the body! I was [merely —]
F/X DOOR OPENS. LEE ENTERS, FOLLOWED BY MEL AND STUART.
His friend told us someone tried to kill her, then we went ona wild goose chase while he was messing about with the body.
I was carefully examining him.
Doctor, for heaven’s sake —
And you thought that was your job, not the police’s?
You’ve seen the body? The black sticky substance around his mouth?
Looks like squid ink.
Yes, and it didn’t come from a squid, so where do you think it [did —]
(FLUSTERED) None of this is any of your business.
Boss, I reckon we should keep them apart until the rozzers get here. Dunno what’s keeping them.
If I killed this man, don’t you think I’d be trying to get away?
How well do you know these people, Melanie?
I can vouch for him. (TO DOCTOR) Where’s Ace?
In my office. Vinny’s with her.
#228: THE BLOOD FURNACE by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 21
SCENE 11. INT. SHIPYARD (FLOOR OFFICE)
F/X VINNY IS KEEPING WATCH OVER ACE.
This is ridiculous. Whoever did it could be miles away by now.
They could, yeah.
I mean, they wouldn’t have hung around!
Maybe. Maybe not.
Did you know him? The man who died?
Everyone knows everyone here. He was a good lad, Joel.
I’m sorry.
So am I.
#228: THE BLOOD FURNACE by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 22
SCENE 12. INT. SHIPYARD
F/X MEL AND THE DOCTOR HANGING AROUND, WAITING. LOW VOICES.
What did you think you were doing?
What I always do.
I suppose. It feels rather different when it happens in front of someone you know.
You seem to know him well.
He was my boyfriend for two years — more than two. He was studying Engineering, after graduation he was offered a job in the Middle East and I was happy where I was, So...
Long distance relationships are awkward.
He’s just offered me a job here.
Oh. And what did you say?
F/X STUART WALKS OVER. MEL GOES TO HIM, EAGERLY.
Stuart?
(A LITTLE CONFUSED) Did you say something, Melanie?
I’ve had a chance to think it over, and — Your nose is bleeding.
Is it?
Here, take a tissue — (AS HE DOES) Are you all right?
It’s nothing. I’ve got a headache. What were you saying?
#228: THE BLOOD FURNACE by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 23
I’1ll take the job.
Mel, you can’t [be —]
Oh wow. That’s amazing.
I can’t wait to get started.
I’ve actually just heard our client is dropping by.
That’s not ideal timing, what with [the —]
The fatality, yes, but she’s not someone you can say no to. You can meet her — she’1l be here any minute.
F/X STUART STARTS WALKING, LEAVING MEL WITH THE DOCTOR.
I’m sorry, Doctor —
You don’t have to apologise.
It was just now — realising the offer might get taken away — it made me realise, I do want it. It’s such a good job for me.
You don’t have to explain.
(OFF) Melanie! I said we’d see her up in the meeting room.
F/X MEL STARTS TO WALK AWAY.
OK — Doctor? I’1l catch up with you before you go?
Of course. (TO HIMSELF) Assuming we’re allowed to leave.
#228: THE BLOOD FURNACE by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 24
SCENE 13. INT. SHIPYARD (OFFICE)
So what do you do here?
Welding. You don’t have to pretend to be interested.
You use like a blowtorch?
Let’s talk about you. Not from round here, are you?
No, I travel around.
So how come you’re poking around a ship?
I wasn’t poking around. I was just here — The Doctor dragged me here.
F/X SAME FLICKER AND SQUELCH WE HEARD IN THE OPENING SCENE.
And why’s he poking around a.. What? What’re you looking at?
(NERVOUS SUDDENLY) Your hands.
Gah, thought I fixed this stupid glitchy piece [of —]
You’re not human.
Very observant.
Did you kill that man?
Oh that’s nice. Assume the alien did it.
Did you?
(BEAT) Yeah.
#228: THE BLOOD FURNACE by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 25
OK — I’m sure you were scared, and you just lashed out —
No, wasn’t like that at all. I’ve got a very, very important job to do and I can’t let anyone get in the way, so —
You’re gonna kill me too.
No. I’m taking you with me.
Where?
Home.
F/X ACE MAKES A QUICK MOVEMENT, BUT VINNY CUTS HER OFF:
Don’t even think about making a move for the door.
I wasn’t. Cos If I did, you’d stop me easy, right?
I would.
That’s why I was planning on hitting you with the paperweight List
What?
F/X ACE PICKS PAPERWEIGHT OFF THE DESK, HURLS IT.
EFFORT
(HIT ON HEAD) Argh!
See ya! (RUNS OUT)
#228: THE BLOOD FURNACE by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 26
SCENE 14. INT. SHIPYARD
F/X ACE RUNS ACROSS THE SHOP FLOOR TOWARDS THE DOCTOR AND LEE.
(OFF) Hey! Hey!
What?
(OFF) It’s that bloke Vinny!
What about him?
(OFF) He’s the killer — he was going to kill me but —
F/X ACE HAS REACHED THEM NOW.
I can’t believe you’re trying to pull this again.
Alright, I lied before — but it’s true this time! He hasn’t followed me so he must be trying to get away —
Show me.
This way.
F/X ACE AND THE DOCTOR RUN OFF.
Hey — hey! You can’t go anywhere till you’ve talked to the rozzers!
#228: THE BLOOD FURNACE by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 27
SCENE 15. INT. SHIPYARD (MEETING ROOM)
F/X MEL AND STUART ENTER.
I wish I’d had time to tidy up.
You should’ve told her you couldn’t see her today.
F/X CAROLYN IS ALREADY THERE.
It’s rather late for that, I’m here now.
Carolyn. Hello.
I gather one of the workers has died? How sad.
The police should be here soon. In fact, I’m surprised [they —]
I’m sure they’1ll sort it out. Who’s this?
Melanie Bush. Lovely to meet you.
This is Carolyn Evans. (TO CAROLYN) I’ve just offered Melanie a job, and she’s said yes.
Oh good, I’ve been telling you you need a secretary.
No, not a secretary.
Much more exciting than that.
Do tell.
Come with us — we’1ll show you!
#228: THE BLOOD FURNACE by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 28
SCENE 16. INT. SHIPYARD (CORRIDOR)
F/X A CORRIDOR ON THE OUTER EDGE OF THE YARD. DOCTOR AND ACE
DOWN IT.
He’s an alien.
I know.
You know?
Well, I knew the murderer was an alien. The residue on his face had a chemical structure that [was —]
Where now?
F/X THEY STOP RUNNING.
You go this way, I’1l go —
F/X MOVEMENT DOWN THE CORRIDOR — IT’S VINNY. HE OPENS AN OUTER
DOOR AND ESCAPES.
That way! There he is!
He’s going outside! After him!
F/X DOCTOR AND ACE RUN, GO THROUGH THE DOOR —
#228: THE BLOOD FURNACE by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 29
SCENE 17. EXT. SHIPYARD (CONTINUOUS)
F/X DOCTOR AND ACE EMERGE ONTO A METAL GANTRY THAT RUNS ON THE
EDGE. CLANGING FOOTSTEPS. BELOW IT IS WATER. THE GANTRY IS RUSTY AND HASN’T BEEN USED IN YEARS: IT CREAKS WHENEVER THEY MOVE. VINNY GRABS THE DOCTOR AS THEY RUN OUT AND HOLDS HIM.
Gotcha.
Urk!
F/X ACE STOPS RUNNING.
Let him go.
No way.
Even if you get past me, look — this walkway doesn’t go anywhere. Unless you want to go for a dip in the Mersey.
She’s right — let’s go back inside and talk about [this —]
No — I’m taking one of you with me and I don’t care who. I want to know who sent you.
We came of our own accord.
You can’t fool me. You’re not from Earth and I’m not sure about her either.
Perhaps we can help [you —]
F/X GANTRY CREAKS UNDERNEATH THEM.
We need to get off this thing — it can’t take the weight.
I’m not going back through there.
Then we’re all going in the river! Don’t be daft —
#228: THE BLOOD FURNACE by Eddie Robson (FINAL)
F/X THE GANTRY BEGINS TO BUCKLE ALARMINGLY...
Woah —
Ace, get back inside —
F/X GANTRY COLLAPSES —
/ACE: /VINNY:
CRY OUT, FALLING
F/X GANTRY HITS THE WATER!
Page 30
#228: THE BLOOD FURNACE by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 31
SCENE 18. INT. SHIPYARD
F/X LEE’S WALKING AROUND.
Has anyone seen Vinny? Don? You seen him? He was in my office, [but —]
F/X DOOR OPENS AND DANUTA WALKS IN. HE’S POSING AS A POLICE
OFFICER AND HAS TWO ASSOCIATES WITH HIM, DOING THE SAME.
(OFF) Looking for Mr Clayton. Lee Clayton?
That’s me.
F/X DANUTA MARCHES OVER TO HIM.
Detective Inspector Marsden. Has anyone left the building since it happened?
#228: THE BLOOD FURNACE by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 32
SCENE 19. INT. SHIPYARD (IT CENTRE)
F/X STUART AND MEL ARE SHOWING CAROLYN THE NEW COMPUTERS.
We’re going to be so much more efficient with this, our designs will be more rigorously tested, and with Melanie on board —
Our aim will be to cut your costs, and deliver what you want that much quicker.
Right. (BEAT) No.
I’m... not sure what you mean.
I was clear that I don’t want this done using computers and you will strip them out immediately.
F/X CAROLYN WALKS OUT OF THE ROOM.
What on Earth was that [about —]
Carolyn — wait!
F/X STUART RUNS AFTER HER.
#228: THE BLOOD FURNACE by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 33
SCENE 20. INT. CAR
F/X VINNY SMASHES THE CAR WINDOW, THEN OPENS THE DOOR AND
SODDEN ACE INSIDE.
COUGHING FROM HAVING FALLEN IN THE WATER; ONLY SEMI-CONSCIOUS
F/X VINNY STARTS TYING ACE’S HANDS.
Hold still.
What happened?
We fell in the water. I pulled you out.
Why?
F/X VINNY PULLS A KNOT TIGHT.
Ow!
Have I tied your hands too tight?
Yes.
Good.
F/X VINNY CLOSES THE CAR DOOR, THEN GETS IN THE DRIVER’S SIDE.
Where’s the Doctor?
I couldn’t get both of you out. I went with you cos that jacket makes you float more.
We’ve got to go back — get him out of there!
F/X VINNY STARTS THE CAR.
No, you have to shut up and I have to get to a place just outside town.
#228: THE BLOOD FURNACE by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 34
F/X THEY DRIVE AWAY.
#228: THE BLOOD FURNACE by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 35
SCENE 21. EXT. SHIPYARD
F/X WATER LAPPING AROUND THE DOCK. LEE AND DANUTA ARE HUNTING
OUTSIDE.
How many ways in and out of this place are there?
Yard doors were bolted, there’s a workers’ entrance and an office entrance, so the only other [way —]
What’s that in the water?
That’s one of them!
F/X THEY RUSH TO DOCKSIDE.
He’s not moving. I think he’s —
(OFF; SUDDENLY SURFACING, CALLING OUT) Good day, gentlemen. I don’t suppose you could help me out of here?
#228: THE BLOOD FURNACE by Eddie Robson (FINAL) Page 36
SCENE 22. INT. SHIPYARD (MEETING ROOM)
F/X CAROLYN ENTERS, MEL AND STUART FOLLOWING.
Stuart, we have other matters to talk about [and —]
But Carolyn, I’ve spent a huge amount of money on all [this —]
Then you should have consulted with me first.
